  8  
  9  /-! # Minimum and maximum w.r.t. a filter and on a aet
 10  
 11  ## Main Definitions
 12  
 13  This file defines six predicates of the form `is_A_B`, where `A` is `min`, `max`, or `extr`,
 14  and `B` is `filter` or `on`.
 15  
 16  * `is_min_filter f l a` means that `f a ≤ f x` in some `l`-neighborhood of `a`;
 17  * `is_max_filter f l a` means that `f x ≤ f a` in some `l`-neighborhood of `a`;
 18  * `is_extr_filter f l a` means `is_min_filter f l a` or `is_max_filter f l a`.
 19  
 20  Similar predicates with `_on` suffix are particular cases for `l = principal s`.
 21  
 22  ## Main statements
 23  
 24  ### Change of the filter (set) argument
 25  
 26  * `is_*_filter.filter_mono` : replace the filter with a smaller one;
 27  * `is_*_filter.filter_inf` : replace a filter `l` with `l ⊓ l'`;
 28  * `is_*_on.on_subset` : restrict to a smaller set;
 29  * `is_*_on.inter` : replace a set `s` wtih `s ∩ t`.
 30  
 31  ### Composition
 32  
 33  * `is_*_*.comp_mono` : if `x` is an extremum for `f` and `g` is a monotone function,
 34    then `x` is an extremum for `g ∘ f`;
 35  * `is_*_*.comp_antimono` : similarly for the case of monotonically decreasing `g`;
 36  * `is_*_*.bicomp_mono` : if `x` is an extremum of the same type for `f` and `g`
 37    and a binary operation `op` is monotone in both arguments, then `x` is an extremum
 38    of the same type for `λ x, op (f x) (g x)`.
 39  * `is_*_filter.comp_tendsto` : if `g x` is an extremum for `f` w.r.t. `l'` and `tendsto g l l'`,
 40    then `x` is an extremum for `f ∘ g` w.r.t. `l`.
 41  * `is_*_on.on_preimage` : if `g x` is an extremum for `f` on `s`, then `x` is an extremum
 42    for `f ∘ g` on `g ⁻¹' s`.
 43  
 44  ### Algebraic operations
 45  
 46  * `is_*_*.add` : if `x` is an extremum of the same type for two functions,
 47    then it is an extremum of the same type for their sum;
 48  * `is_*_*.neg` : if `x` is an extremum for `f`, then it is an extremum
 49    of the opposite type for `-f`;
 50  * `is_*_*.sub` : if `x` is an a minimum for `f` and a maximum for `g`,
 51    then it is a minimum for `f - g` and a maximum for `g - f`;
 52  * `is_*_*.max`, `is_*_*.min`, `is_*_*.sup`, `is_*_*.inf` : similarly for `is_*_*.add`
 53    for pointwise `max`, `min`, `sup`, `inf`, respectively.
 54  
 55  
 56  ### Miscellaneous definitions
 57  
 58  * `is_*_*_const` : any point is both a minimum and maximum for a constant function;
 59  * `is_min/max_*.is_ext` : any minimum/maximum point is an extremum;
 60  * `is_*_*.dual`, `is_*_*.undual`: conversion between codomains `α` and `dual α`;
 61  
 62  ## Missing features (TODO)
 63  
 64  * Multiplication and division;
 65  * `is_*_*.bicompl` : if `x` is a minimum for `f`, `y` is a minimum for `g`, and `op` is a monotone
 66    binary operation, then `(x, y)` is a minimum for `uncurry' (bicompl op f g)`. From this point of view,
 67    `is_*_*.bicomp` is a composition
 68  * It would be nice to have a tactic that specializes `comp_(anti)mono` or `bicomp_mono`
 69    based on a proof of monotonicity of a given (binary) function. The tactic should maintain a `meta`
 70    list of known (anti)monotone (binary) functions with their names, as well as a list of special
 71    types of filters, and define the missing lemmas once one of these two lists grows.
 72  -/
 73

 88  /-- `is_min_filter f l a` means that `f a ≤ f x` in some `l`-neighborhood of `a` -/
 89  def is_min_filter : Prop := ∀ᶠ x in l, f a ≤ f x

 91  /-- `is_max_filter f l a` means that `f x ≤ f a` in some `l`-neighborhood of `a` -/
